definition[0]: if a new idea, product, or method supersedes another one, it becomes used instead because it is more modern or effective
example[0]: Their map has since been superseded by photographic atlases.
definition[1]: if a law, instruction, rule etc supersedes another, it takes its place
example[1]: Theagreement supersedes a similar contract made five years ago.
example[2]: The court ruled that thelaw was superseded by a 1985 statute.
definition[2]: if a product, method, or idea supersedes another one, it is used instead of the old product or idea because it is more modern, effective etc
example[3]: This model has recently been superseded by a newer version made of recycled polyethylene.
